titles.title: To designate the United States Post Office located at 41-42 Norre Gade in Saint Thomas, Virgin Islands, as the "Alvaro de Lugo United States Post Office".

An Act to designate the building at 41-42 Norre Gade in Saint Thomas, Virgin Islands, for ther period of time during which it houses operations of the United States Postal Service, as the Alvaro de Lugo Post Office; and to amend title 39, United States Code, to make applicable with respect to the United States Postal Service exclusionary authority relating to the treatment of remployed annuitants under the civil service retirement laws, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Ms. Collins (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn with an amendment and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 566.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 2574 proposed by Senator Ford for Senator Heflin.
Amendment SP 2574 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Ms. Norton asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendments.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 8/25/1994--Passed Senate amended. Designates the building located at 41-42 Norre Gade in Saint Thomas, Virgin Islands, as the Alvaro de Lugo Post Office for the period it houses operations of the United States Postal Service. Amends Federal law to apply to the U.S. Postal Service authority to request the Office of Personnel Management to waive certain annuity offset requirements, on a case-by-case basis or in emergency or unusual circumstances, with respect to Postal Service retirees it reemploys. Provides that any Federal employee or retiree may make an irrevocable assignment of incidents of ownership in a Federal Employees Group Life Insurance (FEGLI) policy. (Currently this option is reserved to Federal judges only.)
